page.title: Muscle Relaxation
page.subtitle: How Kavalactones relieve tension and promote physical relaxation.

einfuehrung.paragraph1: The muscle-relaxing effect of Kava is one of the most noticeable effects. After the first shell, a wave of relaxation begins to move through the body – tensions dissolve, and the body feels "heavy" and pleasant.
einfuehrung.paragraph2: In traditional use in the Pacific, Kava has been used for thousands of years to relieve muscle pain and physical tension. Modern research has clarified the underlying mechanisms.

mechanismen.title: Mechanisms of Action
mechanismen.intro: The muscle-relaxing effect of Kava is based on several synergistic mechanisms that act on both central (brain/spinal cord) and peripheral levels.

items.title: Sodium and Calcium Channel Blockade
items.text: Kavalactones block voltage-dependent sodium and calcium channels in nerve cells. This reduces the excitability of motor neurons (nerve cells that control muscles) and leads to a decrease in muscle tone. This mechanism is also responsible for the anticonvulsive (spasm-relieving) effect.

items.title: Central GABA Modulation
items.text: The enhancement of GABA effects in the brain and spinal cord reduces central muscle tension. GABA is the most important inhibitory neurotransmitter and also regulates muscle tone at the spinal level.

items.title: Peripheral Effect
items.text: Some Kavalactones also act directly on the smooth muscle (e.g., in blood vessels). This can lead to slight vasodilation (blood vessel widening) and explains the warm feeling that many users report.

quote.text: Kavalactones block voltage-dependent sodium and calcium channels at the neuronal level, contributing to the muscle-relaxing effect.

kavalactone.title: Relevant Kavalactones
kavalactone.intro: Not all Kavalactones have the same muscle-relaxing strength. Two compounds stand out particularly:

dhk.title: Dihydrokavain (DHK)
dhk.description: DHK is the strongest muscle-relaxing Kavalactone. It primarily acts through the blockade of sodium channels and has a pronounced sedative component.
dhk.profile: Strongly muscle-relaxing, sedating, body-focused. Ideal for evening use and for tension.

dhm.title: Dihydromethysticin (DHM)
dhm.description: DHM also has strong muscle-relaxing properties but is also the Kavalactone with the longest duration of action. At high concentrations, it can lead to prolonged fatigue.
dhm.warning: High DHM concentrations (Position 1-2) are typical for Tudei varieties and can lead to "hangover" symptoms.

anwendungen.title: Areas of Application
anwendungen.intro: The muscle-relaxing effect of Kava can be helpful for various complaints:

items.title: Tension in the Neck/Shoulder Area
items.text: Stress and screen work often lead to chronic tension. Kava can help relieve these and improve well-being.

items.title: Back Pain
items.text: For muscle-related back pain, the relaxing effect can provide relief. Kava does not replace medical treatment but can be supportive.

items.title: Tension Headaches
items.text: Headaches caused by muscle tension in the neck and head area can be alleviated through relaxation.

items.title: Menstrual Discomfort
items.text: The spasm-relieving effect can be helpful for menstrual cramps. Traditionally, Kava has also been used for this purpose in the Pacific.

items.title: After Exercise
items.text: For recovery after intense training, Kava can help relax the muscles and promote recovery.

items.title: Restless Legs Syndrome
items.text: Some users report relief from restless legs. The combination of muscle relaxation and anxiolysis can be effective here.

chemotypen.title: Recommended Chemotypes & Varieties
chemotypen.intro: For maximum muscle relaxation, varieties with a high DHK content (Position 2 in the first or second place) should be chosen. These "Heavy" Kavas are body-focused and ideal for evening use.

varieties.name: Palasa (Vanuatu)
varieties.description: Very body-focused, strong muscle relaxation. Ideal for tension.

varieties.name: Palarasul (Vanuatu)
varieties.description: Strongly sedating with good muscle relaxation.

tip.title: Chemotype Tip
tip.text: Pay attention to the Position of 2 (DHK) in the chemotype. The further forward, the stronger the muscle relaxation. A chemotype like 246... or 426... indicates a body-focused variety. Use the Chemotype Calculator to analyze varieties.

praxis.title: Practical Application
praxis.intro: For application in muscle tension, there are some recommendations:

tips.label: Timing:
tips.text: Best in the evening, 1-2 hours before bedtime. The sedative component of muscle-relaxing varieties can make you sleepy.

tips.label: Dosage:
tips.text: 2-3 shells (30-45g powder) for noticeable physical effect. Beginners should start with less.

tips.label: Combination:
tips.text: Heat (warm bath, hot water bottle) enhances the relaxing effect. Light stretching exercises can also be helpful.

tips.label: Regularity:
tips.text: For chronic tension, regular evening use (with breaks) can be beneficial.

tips.label: Hydration:
tips.text: Drink enough water, as Kava can have a slightly dehydrating effect.

feeling.title: The "Kava Feeling"
feeling.text: The physical relaxation from Kava is often described as a pleasant "heaviness." The limbs feel warm and relaxed, and tensions dissolve on their own. This state should not be confused with drowsiness – the mind remains clear, only the body relaxes deeply.
